hypothesis_content.title: News-Driven Spike Fade in Low-Liquidity Hours
hypothesis_content.statement: During Asian trading hours (00:00-08:00 UTC), when BTC experiences a >2.5% price spike within 30 minutes coinciding with major news headlines (as measured by news sentiment APIs), and the spike occurs on below-average hourly volume, price will retrace at least 50% of the spike within the next 4 hours with >65% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-liquidity Asian hours combined with news-driven spikes create ideal conditions for market makers to fade retail excitement. Below-average volume confirms lack of institutional participation, making the move unsustainable.
entry_conditions: BTC price increases >2.5% within any 30-minute window
Volume during spike < 75% of 20-period hourly volume average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial spike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price continues rising to create a >4% total move from pre-spike level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Spike sustains with price maintaining >80% of gains after 4 hours on increasing volume, indicating genuine accumulation.
